channel.title: Need some MORE Client help
channel.description: Ok i'm on ZdiddyReloaded client v.6.I got it working somehow and i now need to change the set ip...I don't have a clue how to do this so help is appreciated.Yes it's an open source.

item.description:

item.title: Need some MORE Client help
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

Delete the signlink.class (NOT .java) and then recompile it. It looks like it was compiled with a newer version of Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some MORE Client help
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“openice123, post:14, topic:190747”][code] public URL getCodeBase() {
if (signlink.mainapp != null) {
return signlink.mainapp.getCodeBase();
}
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
new FileReader(“config/ip.txt”));
String data = null;
String rdata = in.readLine();

        if (super.gameFrame != null) {
            return new URL("http://" + rdata + ":" + (80 + anInt958));
        }
    } catch (Exception _ex) {}
    return super.getCodeBase();
}[/code]

i use this
make a folder called config make a new txt file in config called ip and then put your ip in the txt file
dont need to compile all the time[/quote]
But my client won’t recognise that.Hold on i’m uploading a vid to see something that may be causing it.

http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=5dnmro&s=3

Basically that shows that when i compile the source with the compiler the client came with,i get this;

Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue . . .
Which means it’s compiled succsessfully.

When i compile it with my compiler i get this error;

Applet_Sub1.java:5: cannot access sign.signlink bad class file: .\sign\signlink.class class file has wrong version 50.0, should be 49.0 Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of the classpa th. import sign.signlink; ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Need some MORE Client help
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

[code] public URL getCodeBase() {
if (signlink.mainapp != null) {
return signlink.mainapp.getCodeBase();
}
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
new FileReader(“config/ip.txt”));
String data = null;
String rdata = in.readLine();

        if (super.gameFrame != null) {
            return new URL("http://" + rdata + ":" + (80 + anInt958));
        }
    } catch (Exception _ex) {}
    return super.getCodeBase();
}[/code]

i use this
make a folder called config make a new txt file in config called ip and then put your ip in the txt file
dont need to compile all the time

Read full topic

item.description:
@william1 wrote:

just copy this in

     [code]public URL getCodeBase(){

try
{
return new URL(“127.0.0.1” + (80 + anInt958));
}
catch(Exception _ex) { }
return super.getCodeBase();
}[/code]

item.title: Need some MORE Client help
item.dc:creator: @william1 william1
item.description:
@william1 wrote:

just open up client.java hit ctrl+f then find 43594 and change it to whatever port you want…

and also find public URL getCodeBase() and put your ip in …

your all set
